alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Montezuma County through 245 PM MDT... At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar and satellite imagery were tracking a slow-moving, strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Mancos, or 25 miles west of Durango, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Montezuma County. This includes U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 51 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
